meanings.definition: A speech defect in which sibilants are pronounced as interdental sounds.
meanings.sent1: Her lisp made it hard to say words with 's' sounds.
meanings.sent2: The child's lisp made 'snake' sound like 'thnake'.
meanings.sent3: Despite her lisp, she loved to sing along to songs.
meanings.sent4: The lisp in his speech added a unique charm to his storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's lisp was endearing and unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: He would lisp when saying words with 's' sounds.
meanings.sent2: She lisps slightly when pronouncing certain words.
meanings.sent3: The comedian purposely lisped to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: His lisp added a touch of innocence to his voice.
meanings.sent5: The actor lisped in the role to portray a quirky character.

meanings.definition: A speech defect in which sibilants are pronounced as interdental sounds.

meanings.sent2: She had a noticeable lisp when saying words with 'z' sounds.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lisp, he excelled in public speaking.
meanings.sent4: The lisp in her speech gave her a distinctive voice.
meanings.sent5: His lisp became a signature part of his identity.
